isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - AUTO NEUTRAL OPTION

svcproc.title: AUTO NEUTRAL OPTION
svcproc.para: When the transmission is in drive mode, the auto neutral switch (958) is moved to the on position, and the parking brake is applied, the contacts of the pressure switch (3010) will close and a ground signal will be applied to the Allison ECU (632) pin 12. This signal is provided by circuit 153, connector (466), circuit 153 switch and connector (3010), circuit 153A, switch and connector (958), circuit 143B and 143A to dash panel cab ground (2G). The contacts of the pressure switch (1001) will also close and a ground signal will be applied to the Allison ECU (632) pin 30. This signal is provided by circuit 117, connector (466), circuit 117, switch and connector (1001), circuit 161C, connector (466), circuit 161C and 161 to the ECU signal ground at (632) pin 31. When the ECU sees that both of these inputs are switched low, it will switch the output at its connector (632) pin 2 low. This will allow power to flow from the key switch (24) through circuit 13J, connector (377), circuit 13M, fuse (301), circuit 146, connector (418), circuit 146 and 146E, connector (1), circuit 146E, the coil of the neutral indicator relay (962), circuit 114, connector (466), and circuit 114 to the ECU (632) pin 2. This will energize the relay and allow power to flow from the feed side, electrically hot side of the relay (962), through circuit 146F, the normally open contacts of the relay, circuit 114NO, the neutral indicator light (961), circuit 143D, the closed contacts of pressure switch (960-A) and circuit 143C to the dash panel cab ground (2G). This will cause the neutral indicator to illuminate, thus indicating that the ECU has recognized the request to shift the transmission into neutral and the parking brakes are applied.

When the driver of the vehicle releases the parking brakes, switches (3010), (1001), and (960-A) will open causing the neutral indicator to go off and the transmission to return to drive mode. The transmission will return to drive because switches (3010) and (1001) remove the ground to the ECU connector (632) at pin 12 and 30 respectively. The neutral indicator light will turn off because the contacts of switch (960-A) open and because the ECU switches connector (632) pin 2 high, which de-energizes relay (962).
